title: Creating a Framework for both iOS and watchOS
description: The try! Swift app runs on both iOS and watchOS, and I’d like to expand it to support fancy extensions and possibly something with iMessage. While I was ok duplicating the Model layer between the two platforms initially, as more extensions and platforms are something I want to code quickly on, it was time to move that code out into a framework.

title: How to Reuse Paging Interface Controllers in watchOS
description: I've been trying to figure out how to reuse the same interface controller code for all my interface controllers in a watchOS paging navigation, and finally did. But this solution comes at a price...

title: Scan For Bluetooth Enabled iBeacons Via A Raspberry Pi IoT Device
description:
Lately I’ve been working a lot with iBeacons and Raspberry Pi Internet of Things (IoT) devices. I’ve been building an office monitor for logging foot traffic around the office. I planted a few Raspberry Pi devices around the office and distributed some Gimbal iBeacons to a few of my coworkers so I could determine what part of the office experiences the most heat.

While Raspberry Pi 3 devices come with integrated bluetooth, Raspbian Linux is not configured to support BLE scanning. There are a few packages that must be installed to make BLE scanning possible.

We’re going to see what is necessary to scan for BLE iBeacons using a Raspberry Pi with Raspbian Linux installed.

The post Scan For
